definition: hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?
sentences.chinese: 鸵鸟的翅膀欢然搧展，岂是显慈爱的翎毛和羽毛么？

sentences.english: Wear a dunce cap, hat with feathers, for the dance-like.
sentences.chinese: 头戴高帽，帽著翎毛，作舞蹈状。

sentences.english: Clothing is feathers money is bravery.
their feathers are just too bright.
Erh-lang turned into a huge sea crane and pursued the crow.
sentences.chinese: 二郎神急抖翎毛，摇身变作大海鹤，钻上云霄来啄。

sentences.english: The wings of the ostrich flap joyously: Are they the pinion and plumage of lovingkindness?
sentences.chinese: 鸵鸟的翅膀欢然展翅，是显慈爱的翎毛和羽毛么？

sentences.english: I fled that ground as lightly as a feather.
sentences.chinese: 我逃离大地，轻灵如翎毛。

sentences.english: Even the elegant quill which Umbridge gives Harry to write was designed by the set designers.
sentences.chinese: 甚至恩不里居给哈利的大翎毛笔也是特制而成。

definition: peacock feathers on an official's hat displaying his rank (traditional)/pheasant tail feathers on warriors' helmets (opera)
(bird species of China) common pheasant (Phasianus colchicus)
comb (fleshy crest on a bird's head)
